com.turn.ttorrent.client.storage

Interface TorrentByteStorage

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    FileCollectionStorage, FileStorage

    public interface TorrentByteStorage
    Abstract torrent byte storage.

    This interface defines the methods for accessing an abstracted torrent byte storage. A torrent, especially when it contains multiple files, needs to be seen as one single continuous stream of bytes. Torrent pieces will most likely span accross file boundaries. This abstracted byte storage aims at providing a simple interface for read/write access to the torrent data, regardless of how it is composed underneath the piece structure.

    Author:
    mpetazzoni, dgiffin

    • Method Detail

      • size

        long size()
        Returns the total size of the torrent storage.

      • read

        int read(ByteBuffer buffer,
         long offset)
  throws IOException
        Read from the byte storage.

        Read length bytes at offset offset from the underlying byte storage and return them in a ByteBuffer.

        Parameters:
        buffer - The buffer to read the bytes into. The buffer's limit will control how many bytes are read from the storage.
        offset - The offset, in bytes, to read from. This must be within the storage boundary.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes read from the storage.
        Throws:
        IOException - If an I/O error occurs while reading from the byte storage.

      • write

        int write(ByteBuffer block,
          long offset)
   throws IOException
        Write bytes to the byte storage.

        Parameters:
        block - A ByteBuffer containing the bytes to write to the storage. The buffer limit is expected to be set correctly: all bytes from the buffer will be used.
        offset - Offset in the underlying byte storage to write the block at.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes written to the storage.
        Throws:
        IOException - If an I/O error occurs while writing to the byte storage.

      • close

        void close()
    throws IOException
        Close this byte storage.
        Throws:
        IOException - If closing the underlying storage (file(s) ?) failed.

      • finish

        void finish()
     throws IOException
        Finalize the byte storage when the download is complete.

        This gives the byte storage the opportunity to perform finalization operations when the download completes, like moving the files from a temporary location to their destination.

        Throws:
        IOException - If the finalization failed.

      • isFinished

        boolean isFinished()
        Tells whether this byte storage has been finalized.
